website_summaries.verdict: The Asus Memo Pad ME172V won't set you back a ton, but with much better choices only $50 away, you should simply pay more now and regret less later.
pros: The Asus Memo Pad ME172V carries a low $149 price and its storage can be expanded through a built-in microSD slot
cons: The screen's low resolution produces only fuzzy text, and its painfully narrow viewing angle hides detail
Overall system performance is slow, and the tablet crashes when attempting to run some of the latest games
It also burns through battery life quickly and isn't as comfortable to hold as the Nexus 7

website_summaries.verdict: The Asus MeMO Pad ME172V is a solid low-cost Android tablet for less demanding users, with reliable performance for lighter tasks like Web browsing and media consumption.

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift. The price was INSANELY low and after I reset the unit to factory defaults, it was good to go. The unit is somewhat sluggish compared to smartphones/computers, etc...but it does what I need it to: connect to the internet, allow downloading and streaming. All in all, this was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AlisaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: She loves it and has been able to use pretty much any Google app with no problems
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my teenage daughter. She loves it and has been able to use pretty much any Google app with no problems. Screen is great for video and camera is reasonable quality for video - at least she's pleased. it's also been useful for some school projects and as a quick substitute for a laptop when she's out and doesn't want to drag her laptop along. It drops in a larger purse or fits easily into her book bag. Battery life is a bit problematic. It discharges pretty quickly on standby, though when she's using it the battery seems to last long enough to spend an afternoon at a coffee shop.
customer_reviews.author: Gene A

customer_reviews.title: It has been in the shop longer than we've used it.
customer_reviews.text: The first two weeks we've had it, the tablet would not charge correctly. We sent it in for repair it was gone for 3 weeks. Got it back and now every app we install stops working. Asus just said sorry for the problems your having, just send it back in. It is a hassle to mail this in and they make you pay for shipping every time you send it in. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money to get the Nexus 7. We have one and it is wonderful. I will accept this as a loss and maybe take a trip to the apple store.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: love it, camera could be better
customer_reviews.text: I bought a really really REALLY cheap tablet a few months ago to see if I'd even like working with one, and I did. But the resolution was awful. While researching a bigger tablet for work I found the things that I wanted and when I saw this for sale at 99.00. I gave it a careful look. I knew from the get-go that there would only be a front facing camera and that it really wouldn't be super, but, that isn't why I was getting the unit. Maybe later I'll get a better one but right now... this is quite wonderful. As I have android devices the learning curve is pretty none existent. For a hundred bucks... it's premo.
customer_reviews.author: Sable Jak

customer_reviews.title: ASUS MeMO Pad ME172V-A1-GR 7.0-Inch 16 GB Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet to access things on Google Play and use with my Amazon purchased music products and download things for my Kindle, so this tablet does not get near the usage as my iPad. I do like its small size and light weight. I also use it for accessing the internet when I do not want to carry my iPad and it works great for that. The products seems to work for everything I use it for and would buy another one should the need to replace it arise; it is a good product and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good Android tablet!
customer_reviews.author: Jeepguy

customer_reviews.title: Solid 7 inch tablet
customer_reviews.text: Soiid 7 inch tablet. For the money its delivers what is expected. Tablet does lag sometimes so don't think that this will be blazing fast. Purchased a quadcore 7 inch tablet from W Mart for same price that has no lag at all and is generally faster and better screen resolution but it is only a 8GB so in fairness I think the 2 equal out. Although you can add memory to the 8gb tablet and there is not much you can do with the lag in this one. Still satisfied with the purchase and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Koons

customer_reviews.title: Had to return due to misrepresentation
customer_reviews.text: ****Please be aware, that the picture showing the tablet leaning and having a REAR facing camera is of the Asus Transformer. I was thinking that this MeMO pad was just a smaller version of my TF300T, but it was not.*** It was very nimble, screen responds fine, and for $99, it's hard to beat. However, without the rear facing camera, that was the deal killer for me. If you don't need a rear facing camera, then by all means purchase the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Compatible With Square Register and Reader
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine used for $90 here on Amazon because the off-brand tablet I use is not compatible with the Square Register. This worked straight out of the box and immediately recognized all the available Wi-Fi connections. As soon as I plugged in the Square Reader, it recognized it immediately, and off to the races we went. Don't waste your money on expensive brand-name items. This works fine and is a relative bargain compared to the competition.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet for the price, would nuy it again
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is a good deal for the price, initially was looking for one under $100 but wasn't excited about anything i found in terms of specs and the reviews were no help either. so I came across this one; although never bought anything ASUS but i know their laptops are good, so i went for it, not expecting much! to my surprise it was worth every penny at the end, still don't think it will work as well as the high end ones maybe half way but for basic stuff this one is the one.
customer_reviews.author: oepixels

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful starter tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for homeschooling. We went with the Asus rather than an off brand because I have the Nexus 7 and love it, and this is basically an economy version of the Nexus. This tablet may not have the highest specs, but it's a fantastic first tablet for kids. She runs a dozen educational apps and games and it has no trouble. The price is right, too. We also picked up the warranty from SquareTrade, and some discount accessories. For around $150 and $20 in apps she has tools to teach her spelling, math, science, music and foreign languages for the next two years at least. A definite bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene Kendry

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: We bought my ten year old daughter one of these for Christmas. My wife already had one and since we knew how great the product was and she wanted a tablet, we decided to go with another Asus. The price was a great value. My wife was a tad jealous that we were able to get my daughter a pink one. ;) I would recommend this tablet to anyone familiar and comfortable with android based operating systems. While I have not purchased an ASUS motherboard in awhile (no recent computer upgrades), I have always been impressed with the over all quality of ASUS products.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Had some issues and returned it
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Good price, -16GB, -MicroSD slot. Cons: -Poor viewing angle. -Color reproduction is off somewhat. -No rear camera -Had issue with inconsistent volume level. -External speaker sometimes get stuck in mute after removing headphone plug, had to reinsert and remove to get volume back. -I had to set wifi to automatically turn off during sleep, otherwise it gets stuck in disconnected mode on one of my routers. Other than those cons it's otherwise a pretty good unit. I returned mine and bought a Hisense Sero 7 Pro instead for $129 which has a ISP display for better viewing angle, a rear camera, and the color reproduction is identical to the original Nexus 7.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: She wont put it down
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 10 year old daughter. I was a little concerned about the apparent lack of memory, but after a few months of her using it constantly, I see that it has plenty to run the apps she wants to run. The display is top notch for watching movies. The battery life seems average. I would highly recommend buying the service plan along with this.
customer_reviews.author: wearemr

customer_reviews.title: Worked OK for what I needed it for
customer_reviews.text: I bought it so I could do my online schooling without having to be stuck at my computer desk all the time. It played almost all the games that I had downloaded from the Google play store except 1. the only complaint I have is the tablet wouldn't freeze but being with the smaller processor and ram is was really slow some times. But It worked perfect for what I needed it for I would recommend this tablet to others.
customer_reviews.author: Brookman84

customer_reviews.title: Love my tablet
customer_reviews.text: Its a great tablet at a great price my 18 month old loves to play with it and watch vids how ever if you are a person who demands a lot from a tablet this isint for you it can get slow as it runs out if memory i haven't inserted an sd card to see if it would be faster but also some apps cannot be downloaded into this tablet But overall my personal experience i love this tablet
customer_reviews.author: Dm

customer_reviews.title: Good for the kids
customer_reviews.text: I got this tablet to replace my 6 yr old's Asus Nexus Tablet. We downloaded Netflix and it has worked fine for us. We also downloaded several other games and have had no problem with glitches or non-compatibility. Youtube and web browsing work fine too. My only complain is the camera, it is front facing and it is difficult to take pictures of stuff. Honestly, I was drawn to it for the price and I'm happy with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: Pandiiland

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a pre-schooler to play games
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a less expensive model to immediately return it due to apps not funcitoning properly when installed even with it having plenty of memory. This little guy has been great so far. I have found that once they've played a few games or apps, that it's best to completely shut it down during charging. Seems to 'refresh' the operating system. No complaints so far regarding this little table, at it's mid price range fit our budget.
customer_reviews.author: one4windy

customer_reviews.title: Love my ASUS!
customer_reviews.text: I spent weeks looking up the kind of tablet I wanted, and I'm happy I landed on the ASUS MeMO Pad! I love it to death. It is fast, works well, is durable, and lives forever (nice compared to my crap iPhone!). Make sure you don't buy from Firemall, though. They'll send you a "new" one that's actually really used and has other people's information still on them.
customer_reviews.author: alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Okay Tab
customer_reviews.text: A great tablet for the price. We bought this for my 6 year old son who wouldn't leave our Android phones alone. It runs every app/game we try, but sometimes it gets bogged down and the textures stop rendering on the games. This is always because my sone doesn't close anything after he is done with it. use a "task killer" app and you will love it. Video quality is good for a $120 tab.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Great small tablet for Memos and E-reader and mp3s
customer_reviews.text: The device is good for the needs, I have and apps are very good, the screen is bright and clear and the sound is good too. Please be advise that you will want to purchase, a screen protector, the finger prints linger on the table, so please have a good screen cloth to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Nice starter tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet was a 1st for our 7-year old. It keeps her happy, but for a power user, it falls short. Pros: Asus quality, inexpensive, color choices, decent battery. Cons: Slow to restart or start from the off status, Slower CPU means certain apps hang easily. Overall, this is a good starter tablet or as a power E-Reader. Good for watching movies too.
customer_reviews.author: Dad 2 JET

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids
customer_reviews.text: I have this tablet for my kids 3 and 5. For them it is perfect. I love the security features and the fact i can lock up anything on it. it is a good little tablet - dropped many times and has cracked screen but still works. if you are looking for something to do more than stream internet and watch online tv - this is not machine. however if you are using for online tv and kids games - it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Expected nothing less, it's ASUS!! Our household is filled with ASUS products, routers, laptops, motherboards, tablets...NEVER been disappointed. Always solid, well built and dependable. This little jewel of a tablet is perfect for my 11 year old. It is very well built, sturdy and stiff. It gets slept on, dropped, stuffed in backpacks....never misses a beet. Screen is not to bad to look at at all, processor speed is good. OS is reasonable to manage. Wireless connection is solid and dependable. Have yet to need to fiddle with it in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my mother for her birthday. The size is perfect and there haven't been any issues with it; I was concerned that it would be really slow because of the price; and that the touch input wouldn't be sensitive enough; but everything was great. It's fluid and the interaction feels every bit as good as an iPad. The screen is bright. The product exceeded my humble expectations; I will probably buy another one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy McNeal

customer_reviews.title: SMH
customer_reviews.text: Its cheap for a reason. Charger did not work out of the box. Within two day we started noticing lagging issues. Touch keybord is less than mediocre. I regret buying this for a birthday present. Im sorry to say, I thought ASUS would've made better product considering their history in manufacturing motherboards that receives excellent reviews. This was a sloppy attempt at the tablet market... look else where
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Runs smooth
customer_reviews.text: Have had this tablet for about a half year and it is still running smooth and working pretty fast. For the money we paid for it ($99) there are no complaints, this tablet can hold its own with pricier and more popular tablets. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ejbx2

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly what I expected from a $100 android tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This is nice, handy, very useful with 16GB internal memory. Processor and ram are powerful enough to support multitasking and all multimedia including gaming. I bought it for main purpose to do video chat with friends on skype and it is fulfilling it well. Only shortcoming is if wifi is on then battery drains in 3-4 hours of continuous use. Overall Good value for money. Recommended..
customer_reviews.author: Rahul

customer_reviews.title: No Bluetooth? Really?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10-year old daughter. This is a solid tablet, especially for the price. We've had it for roughly a year now. I wanted to get her a keyboard and was SHOCKED to learn this device doesn't have bluetooth. I would seriously have given this device 4, even 5 stars but the no bluetooth thing is just shocking. The cheapest, non-smart phones have bluetooth!! Wow. Great device, great value. No bluetooth!
customer_reviews.author: C. Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Performance is good. Nor t lightning quick or buttery smooth but very capable. The build is solid and the micro SD slot comes in handy. Viewing angles are so so but for straight on media consumption you could do alot worse. Speakers are surprisingly loud for a tablet albeit a bit tinny which is to be expected. Battery life is ok with moderate mixed use. I bought the device for my daughter and she enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Stafford

customer_reviews.title: I was very excited to receive this tablet
customer_reviews.text: Great price on a great little tablet. I haven't really played with any other tablets to be able to compare, but so far, I love my tablet. It is a convenient size, and the graphics are Samsung quality. Haven't found anything I can't do on it yet. Gave one as a gift...they love it too!
customer_reviews.author: Dede Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the money!
customer_reviews.text: For what it is (a cheap entry-level tablet), it's a fantastic deal. I've used plenty of other cheaper tablets that were pure junk, and didn't even have enough processing power to run angry birds. Not this tablet. It is a solid contender, and has handled everything thrown at it (except the driveway). Luckily I purchased a Square Trade warranty with it, so the drop was covered. I was so impressed with this tablet, I bought another.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan L. Reitz

customer_reviews.title: Good Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This handy lil guy is not only affordable but the images are crisp, the functionality rocks, and sound is superb for a little tablet. The only complaint i have is not in the hardware but in the lack of apps available for this device. It's limited due to programmers writing these apps it is no fault of asus.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Duran

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: I know there are some newer and with better specs tablets but for my personal use which is internet browsing and games for my kid this tablet is way more than enough. Product materials are robust as one can expect from Asus, response is quick and the screen although it isn't the best on the market, it has very clear graphics. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Teng

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money and get a galaxy tab 2
customer_reviews.text: I like the tablet, but I find a few apps I use on my iphone or ones that I would like to try are not compatible. As far as tablets, it is a starter. I was trying to save a few bucks and see it is even $20 cheaper than I paid in a month. It would be great for a kid, but not an adult. I use it to play candy crush and watch movies.
customer_reviews.author: zmonster8u

customer_reviews.title: Decent tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is not lightning fast but fast enough. One great feature is that it allows you to utilize the entire formatted 12.8GB of storage which some tablets won't let you do this they set a predetermined size of memory for apps and the other storage what ever that may be is for music so overall it's a pretty decent tablet i recommend this tablet for first time and intermediate users this tablet should serve well for adults or kids.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Crashes constantly.
customer_reviews.text: Samsung won't push kitkat, processor is always maxed out. Plays netflix but you can't search netflix for a movie to watch without it crashing. Even when I first got it, and can't remove the crapware to free up some processing. Can't even limit the crapware running in the background.
customer_reviews.author: t anderson

customer_reviews.title: Okay for this user.
customer_reviews.text: Well, here is the deal. I simply wanted a tablet that would suffice to pick up email and do some surfing without having a lot of complicated stuff. So far, it is doing okay. It's a little slow in unblurring the text when it appears and, it is a little sensitive....jumps off site with slightest touch. But for the price, it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I own three of these tablets now, so obviously, I like them. My son has broken his screen in three places and still the thing works fine. You don't even realize you're working with a cracked screen. I had gotten the cheaper android tablets before this and the Asus is SOOOOO much better for hardly any more money. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: momof7

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item for my 8 years old niece. She loved it.I would say it is a decent product int his price range, din;t like the image resolution much. A backside camera would have been great +, however it has only front facing camera. Apps runs at avg speed, and comes with good no of preloaded apps. I would recommend this product to kids not for adults and grown ups they may find it cheap.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Best price available!
customer_reviews.text: Had a bit of an issue with accessing wireless and contacted the manufacturer. They walked me through a factory reset and a few more steps that seemed to resolve the issue. Otherwise, this has been a solid buy for the value and made a 10 yr. old birthday girl very happy. Great deal on Amazon.com!
customer_reviews.author: Fezzywezzy

customer_reviews.title: It does everything I expected -- and more. It's a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ePad. Each day I am discovering new things that it will do. I love the Kindle Reader, YouTube, email, and To Do Pad features, as well as the ease of downloading Apps and music. Overall, it's an excellent investment. The only problem I have had is that I have a slight tremor, which makes it difficult to use the virtual keyboard. That's definitely NOT a problem of the MeMO Pad -- and it's getting easier as I figure out exactly how I need to place my finger. I have been thinking that a stylus might help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery Died after 9 months.
customer_reviews.text: Tablet stopped working after very, very mild use. I had it for 9 months, but i have a Kindle Fire and a Galaxy Tab, so i didnt use it that often. The battery died without warning, and its not accepting further charges. Tried charging with lower amp chargers, through usb ports...nothing. I understand batteries have limited charge cycles, but 9 months with proper use is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Quico

customer_reviews.title: Decent Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I like this tablet. I've only had issues with the place to insert the power cord. I think my kids have watched Netflix on it with the tablet plugged in too much since it doesn't always charge now. I have to have the cord in just the right position for it to charge. Other than that, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overheating problem
customer_reviews.text: The battery tends to over heat easily after 30 minutes of candy crush game play multiple times. It will crash and shut itself down. After it cools down, it can be used again. Other competitive models that I have (nexus 7, cheaper $50 to $100) do not have that problem. The graphic is comparable with nexus but the overheating is an issue at least for the asus 7 that I have. I ordered it in september 2013. About 4 months ago. Unfortunately, Amazon only has one month exchange policy. Does the manufacturer has a exchange policy.
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: Great, although there is a click during some audio output.
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. Two people who have seen it have ordered their own. One of them sent back a 10inch of another brand to get this one. My only complaint is a a click when I stream certain radio stations. I don't think it's a defect since the sound is fine during video games and voice recordings.
customer_reviews.author: John (TheFrugalFatGuy)

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old grand-daughter and she was quite happy with it,I had my son check out the system and he said it was very good for the price I paid for it went to say it was better than the kindle,this is an excellent product you can't go wrong with it,has more features than the i-pad
customer_reviews.author: Rick M

customer_reviews.title: Good entry-level tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device for one of my children this Christmas, and she loves it. Granted, she's only 10 years old, and doesn't have any serious technical needs beyond You Tube, Netflix, and simple games, but this tablet is able to handle those needs well. I haven't experienced any of the delays or other glitches some reviewers experienced with Netflix or other video products. This tablet is well worth the money I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Cameron

customer_reviews.title: I was little bit disappointed by its screen display quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift. It's an OK product. I was little bit disappointed by its screen display quality. However, I recently bought a newer version of ASUS 8" tablet; and the new one is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: AOS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a starter tablet!
customer_reviews.text: We got this tablet as a gift for my nephew. It is a good starter tablet, a little slower than one I'd like as my own tablet, but still excellent. Very cost effective and it looks great. I also love Asus' product warranty, so this is an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Areta

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tablet. I bring it everywhere. The only thing I wish it had was a flash. The camera takes good pictures outside but inside you need decent lighting. Anyway overall it is great and the price is good. I've checked out others and thus by far beats them.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny Stack

customer_reviews.title: Worked.... I never used it. ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked.... I never used it... I gave it away. Limited. The, again, I had limited knowledge at the time about it's resources. It did work, however, and still does.
customer_reviews.author: GaryBrazil

customer_reviews.title: Sucked for video chatting
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the one we got is defective or what... I purchased one of these for my girlfriend in mexico so we could video chat better. The speakers and mic create a feedback loop so we're back to her old laptop. I was left with expensive browny points.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Dreyer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with this ASUS product
customer_reviews.text: The Android OS, the size and speed of the tablet were all amazing. However, I discovered that many other people have had problems with the tablet shutting off and indicating that the battery was low even after hours charging.
customer_reviews.author: Rhade70

customer_reviews.title: New toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7-year-old grandson so that he would leave my iPad alone. What a good purchase. He has his games on the pad but I hid any icons that I did not want him to access such as stores or internet. It is a good size for him and he is really enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Deana

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tablet, it can not compare to ipad but for the money it's very good! I bought this for the kids and they love it, very easy to use, nice sound, as clear as it can be, will recomend if anyone is looking for an inexpensive tablet.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Terrible tablet/no specified warranty period.
customer_reviews.text: Bad product. This tablet was glitchy from day one and it is my fault for not returning it right away. After 3 months I attempted to return it without success. I could not find any specific warranty period even after registering it. So now I'm stuck with a tablet that offers about 1/2 the performance it should...
customer_reviews.author: Ron G.

customer_reviews.title: In one year significantly battery life decreased and very slow in simple operation like opening app
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my dad as gift. In one year significantly battery life decreased and very slow in simple operation like opening app. Maybe for this amount of money it the quality you get.
customer_reviews.author: Lidiya Grushetska

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, well-made, gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a 5/5, but I would prefer it to be a 9/10. It is a cheap tablet that lets me surf, game, and read for much longer than I need it to. It feels great in the hand, and is compatible with most apps that I want. Power is a slight problem, and there is occasionally noticeable lag, but its slim design (fits into my cargo shorts pocket) and easy-to-grip back makes this a great buy for somebody on the market for a cheap tablet from a name-brand!
customer_reviews.author: jracademia

customer_reviews.title: Well priced, able tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father. A good, solid basic, somewhat slow tablet. Screen is better than decent, uses Jelly Bean and can do most of the stuff that tablets do. If you want a no frills, very reasonable priced tablet, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for little kids. My daughter has owned this tablet for close to two years now and its still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Ivelimi

customer_reviews.title: does the trick
customer_reviews.text: This tablet may not preform like the most expensive. It does do all the things which I require. For the money you can't beat it. The memo function was the winning feature for me.
customer_reviews.author: solon48

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Love my tablet. However, it did randomly shut off and never turn back on without warning after about 4 months and I had to send it in to be repaired. The warranty allowed me to get a new one after I sent the old one in, I just had to pay to ship it out.
customer_reviews.author: Echo

customer_reviews.title: Best $120 I ever spent
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been perfect, battery last well over 8 hrs of use, a little less watching movies or streaming video from places like Max Go and Netflix. I would do it again, actually already have for the daughter, but in pink.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cash

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tweens
customer_reviews.text: My ten year old daughter saved her money up to get a tablet and this was perfect for her. It is easy to use, lets her play games, listen to music, take pictures - everything she wanted to do. It is a simple, basic tablet but perfect for a tween.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 80 mom to look at pictures and she likes it but the battery rounds down so fast and she is does not live in a " remember to recharge world" and gets frustrated easily when it needs a re charge before use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 4 refurbished lenovo tablets for our kids for Xmas. When one came damaged we got this as a replacement. Now I wish I had purchased 4 of these instead. They are sturdy and work great. Not all of the apps in the google play store work though.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I like the pad but it stopped working and could not return to Amazon because it was outside of the time frame for returns. Had to return to ASUS which cost me a shipping charge. After carefull consideration, it really wasn't necessary to buy a tablet because I can get all my downloaded material on my phone for reading. I've come to appreiate my phone more and buying the tablet and all the problems I've had isn't worth the money I've spent. I'd considered getting a Kindle Fire HD but I've changed my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The tablet essential thing
customer_reviews.text: The tablet do the essential thing its responsive, fast, small, and you can take and go everywhere with it, for the price its a good and smart option.
customer_reviews.author: G. Setaro

customer_reviews.title: good tablet
customer_reviews.text: From the same makers of the famous NEXUS 7 google tablet, asus gives us a tablet that has the perfect balance between quality, price-performance, this tablet has a spotless building materials and quality that only this great Taiwanese manufacturer can give us ,
customer_reviews.author: NKLT

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if I just use my computer too ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I just use my computer too much but it is tough to get used the ASUS, and some of the function seems out of date, especially now.
customer_reviews.author: nweller

customer_reviews.title: Great Price & Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet was easy to set up and works great. It does exactly what I got it for and I am very happy with it. I was able to transfer files onto it from my pc, download apps from the Google Play Store, access my email and the internet.
customer_reviews.author: RedKittyTop Contributor: Crochet

customer_reviews.title: great product for price
customer_reviews.text: i am a mother of 6 kids.. well we all know how kids love to share so we were looking in to tablets for christmas this past year. after about 3 months these tablets are still just as great as when they got them. i even bought for my lil sister, if you are looking for a great deal on tablets all memo tablets seem to be great :)
customer_reviews.author: lori moreno

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed :/
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is a little sluggish in performance but otherwise it's a decent/cheap tablet. I would say if you're only willing to spend a hundred dollars, then buy this, otherwise spend a little more and get a Nexus 7.
customer_reviews.author: SaabGuy85

customer_reviews.title: First tablet
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this as an alternate e-reader to my basic Kindle and for checking e-mail, a little web-surfing. I didn't want to spend too much since I was skeptical as to how much I'd use it vs my smart phone and laptop. Overall it has been a pleasant surprise. The tutorial was sub par but Android is pretty intuitive. Quality and features seem comparable to my boss' I-pad for 1/4 the price. I'm satisfied but will probably upgrade in a year or two as new features come online for less $.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good entry level tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift; good entry level tablet. I wish it had lasted longer, but it had an acceptable life span for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Super Happy w/ Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the negative reviews before buying the tablet and was a little worried about what I was going to be getting. All I can say is this is a great little tablet. Very vivid colors on screen, great sound, great price and just the right size for my purse. Very good quality, I'm a happy shopper !!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Harvey

customer_reviews.title: OK for little ones.
customer_reviews.text: This is diffenently not a tablet for adults or skilled adults. If you just want something to play a few games on or check your email... well ok. This is a entry level tablet.!
customer_reviews.author: shopperV

customer_reviews.title: flappy bird
customer_reviews.text: its fine I guess it would be great for a kid it seems a little slow and it is very heavy for a small tablet but overall it is fun to have and I have flappy bird on it so I can not even think of getting a different one ha!
customer_reviews.author: mmmmmmmmmm

customer_reviews.title: Yeah!! Wonderful Tablet
customer_reviews.text: For what I use it for, it does a great job. I use it for my Evernotes, calendar, email access, and my to do lists. I am not using it for the Internet, but the few times I have gone on it gives me a great response time. This was the perfect solution to getting organized.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: very very 5.0 out of 5 stars Excelent Tablet I love this tablet, it has everything you want is in here for a great price. Angood
customer_reviews.text: muy buena y degran calidad un vendedor rapido bueno y efectivo grac5.0 out of 5 stars Excelent Tablet I love this tablet, it has everything you want is in here for a great price. An excelent tablet for daly uses, ias
customer_reviews.author: luis hernandez

customer_reviews.title: its an awesome device in this price..
customer_reviews.text: i have installed lot of apps in this but still working good... video quality is awesome.. i can play youtube videos in HD. facebook, hangout and skype is running perfect i just dont like camera qulity but in his price this device is awesome..... love it..
customer_reviews.author: Dhaval Parikh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. Love every inch of it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Love every inch of it. It can go slow sometimes but I got an app to help boost the speed. Other than that it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sujey

customer_reviews.title: Bad images and pictures, ok to play.
customer_reviews.text: Nice for kids. The quality of the images and pictures is not good but my girls use it to play games. Don't try to take pictures, the camera is really bad.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Duarte

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my girlfriend. It was her first tablet and she's in love with it. It gave her a little scare recently where it took a long time to boot up. But it only happened once and has been working with no hiccups since.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: don't get it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and after 4 months it stop working. I was told I couldn't get refund or replacement. I try to send it to be fix but they told me they can't. Not a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Krzysztof Jasiurkowski

customer_reviews.title: for the price it's okay, processor can become bogged ...
customer_reviews.text: for the price it's okay, processor can become bogged at times but for streaming Netflix or playing games for small kids it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: desert rat

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price..No it's not an Apple or a Samsung, but functions just as well for the average tablet user for a fraction of the cost. It's fast, has good quality video, etc....
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Cliche, but it IS a good tablet for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for my daughter for Christmas. She loves it. Easy to use, full Android features, fast set up. Her only grip is that the power button is positioned right where a corner strap for most tablet cases sits, so it turns off sometimes, but other than that, she loves everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Lysa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure what to expect. Yet, this tablet is great. I wanted one to learn more about it so I could teach my students in my computer lab. I already have an iPad, but needed something smaller to fit better in my purse. I am definitely NOT disappointed. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl W

customer_reviews.title: A great entry-level tablet
customer_reviews.text: Has good resolution and is mostly problem-free. Enough memory for apps. μSD slot expands storage up to 32 GB. The only thing lacking is Bluetooth connectivity and a forward-facing camera.
customer_reviews.author: LoneWolffe

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I am a college student and needed a cheap and light tablet so I could follow along with the professors powerpoints. It's great for simple stuff like notes. I don't use it for games. It can hold a charge for a few days with occasional use. I like it, small, light, cute, and affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, just not for me
customer_reviews.text: I hated this thing. I found out I am definitely an Apple person, not an android person. Why 4 stars then? I gave it to my daughter who never had a tablet. She has just launched a career in sales that is quickly rising and she needed something exactly like this. It tells her how to get to her sales calls, keeps track of her leads, entertains my grandson, etc. And you Android people know exactly how it does all these things. It is not an issue for her that it's an entry level tablet because she's an entry level user; she doesn't even have a smart phone. Go ahead and buy it for the tablet neophyte in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Debs

customer_reviews.title: Very good Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. It has the right size to bring in anywhere, I like to read on it, listen song, see may email, play games... And it is light so I don't get tired holding it. The only problem that I have is that it has small time of battery when you are using all the time, but I can use extra battery and keep using the whole day.
customer_reviews.author: Aila

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 7 yo. She's only had it a week but she loves it and it runs great . Only has a forward facing camera which is a bit odd but she hasn't complained. Battery life is good. Pink color is super cute.
customer_reviews.author: Reesie

customer_reviews.title: Great basic work tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Great for work purposes but definitely not meant for fun. Many apps aren't compatible and video is very limited or non-existent.. Love the size and portability. This will remain my work tablet but I ordered a different one now for personal use.
customer_reviews.author: C B D

customer_reviews.title: Very limited battery life and too slow
customer_reviews.text: Battery life and latency are just too low and slow for me to love this device. It's cheap and I like having it as a back up device but it is not a very good tablet. Perfect for children perhaps.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mancini

customer_reviews.title: Entry level.
customer_reviews.text: A great device. No bluetooth though. I would like to have seen a few more features. Overall, it is a very dependable and handy tool to have. I use it often and have found a few accessories help to make it more useful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this MeMO Pad for my Granddaughter of 11 yrs and she was so happy it was worth every penny. So far it has performed fantastically and I am very please with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Cirello

customer_reviews.title: As a Gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for my Grandkids. They love them. It is great for book reading and streaming videos. I have to limit their time on them.
customer_reviews.author: Tammi

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a high end tablet, but it has a lot of bang for the buck. I got it for a great price, it certainly does everything I had hoped for and more. I have a PC, I have a laptop, I just wanted a tablet that I could check my email with, pop onto facebook from time to time, establish a calender etc. I does all that I need, is very user friendly and you can't beat the price. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Z.

product_meta.title: ASUS MeMO Pad ME172V-A1-GR 7.0-Inch 16 GB Tablet (Grey)
